Earlier, at [35-42], the bottle was completed with the Coca-Cola logo and cap. At [25-35], the bottle was filled with colorful chocolate beans and assembled. At [18-25], the bottle halves were coated with chocolate sauce. At [04-10], the bottle was cut in half and stacked. At [01-04], the bottle was shaken and emptied. These steps collectively show four transformations: emptying, cutting and stacking, coating with chocolate, and assembling into a final product. This aligns with Option B, which states the bottle is altered or transformed four times. Option A suggests three transformations, missing the final assembly. Option C suggests two transformations, which is insufficient. Option D suggests five transformations, which is not supported. Therefore, Option B is the most accurate.
</think>
